title: victorygreymon
body:
An Ultimate-level Dragon Man [[Digimon]] that is a subspecies of WarGreymon, whose influence is visible in its design. VictoryGreymon wields a sword called the Dramon Breaker, and fights using special breaking and striking techniques instead of slashing like with a typical sword. It is stated to have originated from a Digitama whose data structure was altered.

VictoryGreymon is the Partner Digimon of [[Tatsuno Tsurugi]] in [[Digimon Next]], where it debuted with its counterpart [[Z'dGarurumon]].

title: thel'vadam
body: An [[alien]] character from the [[halo (series)|Halo]] franchise, introduced in Halo 2. Originally a highly-capable Covenant fleet commander, 'Vadam was disgraced and condemned to death following the events of the first Halo game and his failure to prevent the destruction of the titular ringworld. Forced to take the mantle of [[Arbiter]], he would survive and ironically ally with [[master_chief|the man responsible]], and the two would work together to bring an end to the Human-Covenant War.

title: araka_luto
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber]] and 2nd batch member of [[Prism Project]]. She's a small [[demon girl]]. She wears a black dress with crimson stripes and black gloves. She has a crimson demon eye on her chest, that can reflect light. She has a pair of black-crimson demon wings on her back. The crimson parts of the wings are semi-transparent. Also on her back, she has a black tail with a crimson butterfly at the end of it. She wears black shoes.

She has purple eyes with a small light pink butterfly accent on them. Her ears are long and pointy, and she has small round crimson earrings on them. She has a pair of tiny fangs in her mouth. She has long crimson hair, that goes beyond the hip area, and an ahoge on the top of it. She has a dark red butterfly pin on her left side of her hair. She has also a pair of small demon wings that serve as horns.

She's very loud, will often swear, is a total prankster, and, to be quite honest, a troll. Her laugh is often described as a mix of a seagull and an industrial printer. 

Her fans are called "Kalutists".


Her character designer is [[Amashiro Natsuki]].

h4. External links

* "Youtube":https://www.youtube.com/c/LutoAraka/
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/LutoAraka

title: mazinger_zero_(mecha)
body:
A transformation caused by reaching the 7th Black Box, Majin Change. At this state, the pilot becomes attached to some of the wires and circuitry which enters their body, becoming a part of Mazinger. Through the use of the Metamorphosis black box, the blades on its body can be used for various close combat attacks. In this form, Mazinger gains a great increase in power, enough to destroy an entire planet. However, the pilot and robot enter a frenzied rage causing them to destroy anything in sight until nothing is left.

ZERO possesses a sentient artificial intelligence that merges with its pilot, allowing it to move without one and even have a personality. ZERO desires to be the only super robot in existence and the presence of another Mazinger is one of the things that can set it off, desiring the destruction of this obstacle above all else. Due to the link between the pilot and Z, if any of the pilots possess a state of madness ZERO will be activated.

After consuming multiple timelines, ZERO had managed to become its own independent entity no longer held back by a pilot or even a reality- Possessing enough power to influence other realities where it is the only Mazinger or super robot in all of existence. The only threat to ZERO however was its main pilot, Koji Kabuto who was influenced by the changing timelines and is able to indirectly control the Reality Manipulation Black Box.

title: mission_impossible_(bkub)
body:
Lasting from 2012 to 2014, [b]MISSION IMPOSSIBLE[/b] (or "Mission Impossibull":[https://twitter.com/WAHa_06x36/status/320161665935093761]) was a (largely) [[4koma]]-based series by [[bkub]], his first on Takeshobo's MangaLifeWIN online publication, and his second-ever serialization after [[Super Elegant]].

It follows [[Marimony Manumonica]], brand new British spy, joined by the pride of the Top-Secret Intelligence Bureau, [[Agent Legend]], as they go on not-so-ordinary spy missions.

Lasted for two volumes, and was succeeded by [[poptepipic|Pop Team Epic]] in 2014.

title: tails_doll
body:
A character appearing only in [[Sonic R]], depicted as a floating [[puppet]] made in the image of [[Tails (Sonic)|]] with the addition of a red [[gem]] emerging from a wire on the top of its head.

Its only special abilities in the game proper are to hover after a jump (without losing height) for an extended duration compared to other characters and to constantly float (whether standing still or moving) without losing speed or sinking when moving over water. Officially, [[Dr. Eggman]] created it with the intent that its doll-like appearance would catch [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] off guard.

Its [[expressionless|blank expression]] and slow move speed have lent it some popularity in horror memes, including a creepypasta that claims successfully using Tails Doll to win a race against [[Super Sonic]] will cause it to attack the player in real life.

title: brown_thoroughbred_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. One of many "Friends" in Japari Park. The Thoroughbred Trio were created for a promotion involving the Anime and the [[Japan Racing Association]]. They have since integrated with the wider franchise and the JRA moved on with [[umamusume|a different franchise]].

The Domestic Horse ([i]Equus ferus caballus[/i]) is a one-toed hoofed animal often used as a best of burden. With time, they were eventually bred for  many uses. The Thoroughbred breed is a hotblooded breed made from a mix of Arabian, Barb and Turk horses, bred specifically for speed and racing. They are the breed used in flat racing.

A "bay" horse denotes a horse with a brown coat with leg points (darker fur on the legs). A "brown" horse denotes a bay horse with a near-black coat, containing some lighter brown hairs. Not to be confused with a black horse (uniformly black aside from any potential white markings) or a dark bay horse (a darker brown with leg points but no black hair).

Brown Thoroughbred is (naturally) a [[horse girl]] with long black hair resembling a mane, wearing a black sports ensemble.

title: dolly_parton_challenge_(meme)
body:
[b]Dolly Parton Challenge[/b], also known as the hashtag #DollyPartonChallenge and LinkedIn/Facebook/Instagram/Tinder Profile Pictures, refers to a series of four-panel images in which people share what could be their profile pictures for different social media accounts. The images, which became popular on Instagram after singer [[Dolly Parton]] posted four examples of profile pictures in January 2020, typically compare the differences in LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and Tinder.

title: sachiko_(vocaloid)
body:
Sachiko is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by the YAMAHA Corporation, and was released for the VOCALOID4 engine. 

Her name is derived from her voice provider, [[Kobayashi Sachiko]]. Her appearance was illustrated was designed by [[Midori Foo]]. She wears [[Japanese clothes|Japanese style clothing]] with [[cherry_blossoms|cherry blossom]] print. She has a large [[obi]] and [[furisode|long sleeves]] with [[speaker]]s on them. She wears [[thigh boots]] and a flowered [[hair ornament]].

Her hair is [[black hair|black]] and her eyes are [[brown eyes|brown]].

title: boston_crab
body:
A professional [[wrestling]] hold that typically starts with the opponent lying supine on the mat, with the wrestler standing and facing them. It is a type of spinal lock where the wrestler hooks each of the opponent’s legs in one of his arms, and then turns the opponent face-down, stepping over him in the process. The final position has the wrestler in a semi-sitting position and facing away from his opponent, with the opponent’s back and legs bent back toward his face being very careful not to follow through. This often sees the attacking wrestler perform double leg takedown.

A single-leg variation exists, where instead of hooking both of the opponent's legs, the wrestler simply hooks one of his opponent's legs.

title: kafuru_(senran_kagura)
body:
One of the five new characters in [[Senran Kagura Estival Versus]].

Kafuru is the youngest of the Mikagura sisters. A girl with a selfish and calculating streak, she often speaks to others in a condescending manner, riling them up. Whether it’s through her fluent use of Internet slang or clever use of baby talk, her mockery knows no bounds. That being said, she knows better than to try and adopt those same mannerisms with her sisters, though she is known to tease [[Hanabi (senran kagura)|]] from time to time. She has a chest that’s neither big nor particularly small.

She has [[purple eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] stylized in [[low twintails]] with [[bangs]]. Wears a [[blue dress|blue]] [[dress]].

Her seiyuu is [[Izawa Shiori]].

h4. External Links

* "Kagurapedia: Kafuru":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Kafuru

title: krampus_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Mennsuke]]

A Transient with a frightening visage, long horns sprouting from his jet black mane, and a Sacred Artifact in the form of large Claws. He attends the Tokyo Santa School, training day in and day out to become a full-fledged Dark Santa. Though he plays the role of the atrocious fiend to frighten children for work, when he drops the act, he returns to his timid and calm demeanor. Secretly distressed at the thought of remaining alone for the foreseeable future, he is easily moved to tears by any kindness directed toward him. He has a strong disdain for naughty kids who harm others for their own benefit.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Krampus":https://housamo.wiki/Krampus

title: morrighan
body: Morrighan is a goddess of Erinn in the [[Mabinogi]] universe. She is the black-winged Goddess of War and Vengeance, who provides blessings to the people and warriors of Tir Na Nog.

title: behemoth_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Mennsuke]]

A Transient originally born in the world of Eden, but cast down to Gehenna, Behemoth is known as the great beast of the earth. While he is fearsome at first glance, behind his terrifying exterior, he is actually extremely kind and thoughtful. Arriving in Tokyo introduced him to a wide variety of vibrant scents and flavors, and he has been entranced by them ever since. The inside of his mouth is actually his Sacred Artifact: a Maw, which converts anything that he eats to energy in order to help him fulfill his Role as a Sacrifice made to a Pairidaeza. As he is used to a solitary life, he has little concept of relying upon others or being relied upon. He is a little embarrassed about his lack of restraint when it comes to food, so he greatly admires others who can match his appetite but are capable of better controlling themselves.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Behemoth":https://housamo.wiki/Behemoth

title: barguest_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Mennsuke]]

A mountain spirit Transient incarnated in the shape of a bear. Due to unforeseen circumstances, he lost his Summoner. He currently belongs to the Arakawa Guild among other Stray Transients who have gathered in self-defense. In order to earn their keep, they do the dirty work commissioned by the Roppongi Guild. He cares deeply for his friends and holds good will toward anyone who would show compassion toward his friends.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Barguest":https://housamo.wiki/Barguest

title: bathym_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Mennsuke]]

A Transient summoned from the world of Gehenna. He is prone to flashy battles and can usually be found at the underground Colosseum of the Ikebukuro Guild. He uses his agility and tricky movement to his advantage. Because of his friendly demeanor, he has many ardent fans. He's not particularly fond of opponents who only fight to win. On the other hand, he likes opponents who prioritize pleasing the crowd.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Bathym":https://housamo.wiki/Bathym

title: amatsumara_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Mennsuke]]

Even the Crafters' blacksmith can present himself as a professional educator when the occasion calls for it. He boasts a pocket-sized version of his Sacred Artifact that he keeps in his breast pocket. His bodybuilding efforts work to show off his back muscles and particularly protruding pectorals. He isn't accustomed to formal dress, but he is rather enjoying the praise it is earning him from his beloved family and friends. At the end of the day, he is most comfortable at his smithy, where he can work without stuffy clothing getting in the way of his muscles. He is especially adept at crafting items that illuminate forms; his artificial eye, which illuminates the truth, and his mirror, which illuminates the world, both stand as testament to his peerless skill."

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Amatsumara":https://housamo.wiki/Amatsumara

title: ooki_ikutoshi
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[kuro nezumi inu]]

This middle school student rebels against the teachings of his martial artist father and frequents the Underground Colosseum where the Transients of Ikebukuro gather. His skills and abilities have been trained from a young age, putting him on equal footing among even the Rankers of Ikebukuro. He identifies as a professional fighter and makes a living off of fight money. Though he is rebelling against his father, he looks up to martial artists who take pride in their skills and have quick and agile moves.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Ikutoshi":https://housamo.wiki/Ikutoshi

title: durga_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Koucha Inu]]

When all her scattered pieces were bound together and she appeared in Tokyo, she retained only faint memories of her former world. Had she been a tiger before? It didn't seem so, but it didn't matter to her. All that chips away at her heart now is the intense expectation of victory. In a body that may not be her own, with a name that may not be her own; possessing only the vaguest of memories, and a Sacred Artifact with ten different forms at her back, she moves toward a new battle, with nothing but a thirst for victory in her chest.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Durga":https://housamo.wiki/Durga

title: otohime_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Gozu farm]]

The artificial celestial maiden that is the manager of the experimental subrealm at the bottom of the sea in System Takamagahara, popularly known as the Dragon Palace. Otohime is believed to possess a beauty that is beyond anything in this world as she entertains and dances with the fish. She was born for the sake of developing and verifying techniques meant to seal painful memories that deeply scar people's minds so that they can heal. She has so few expressions it's as if she has no emotions. However, this is in consideration for those whose minds are pained from even being smiled at, so by no means is Otohime emotionless. As proof of that she has deep sympathies for those who are hurt and those who are devoted, and she has an appropriate amount of anger towards those who disturb the peace. In emergencies she will turn into a dancer who fights on the front lines with her fish-type companion bots. She has the respect of those who live in difficult-to-describe dirty rooms as the leading cleaning consultant in Tokyo.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Otohime":https://housamo.wiki/Otohime

title: tsathoggua_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gammachaos]]

One of the executives of the Roppongi Tycoons, the strongest guild in the 23 wards. He was a ruling entity in his previous world, but that is ancient history. He's now a proud shut-in to be found in the VIP room located underground in the massive Tokyo Casino. He may be a NEET now, but he's still the strongest of the strong. The immense power of his Rule and Sacred Artifact make him a peerless player in Western Tokyo. That said, he's got enough assets to let him live out his days without ever working again. He never goes outside if he can avoid it, and is thus surprisingly welcoming of anyone who visit and cite themselves as friends.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Tsathoggua":https://housamo.wiki/Tsathoggua

title: hombre_tigre_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[gammachaos]]

A Transient originating from the world of El Dorado. While a student by day, outside of school hours he works in professional wrestling, where he plays an up-and-coming Técnico specializing in the Mexican style of Lucha Libre. He is known in the ring for his energetic demeanor and crowd-pleasing performances: his matches often see him bloodied and almost beaten by unscrupulous foes who exploit his every weakness, only for him to suddenly seize victory in a dramatic turnaround, and this has gained him great popularity. To fly higher and farther than anybody else is his dream, and he wishes only to spend the rest of his days in the ring. He struggles most with getting along with others who live their lives on the edge, perhaps because of how much they mirror himself.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Hombre Tigre":https://housamo.wiki/Hombre_Tigre

title: nakatsugi_kyuuma
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Kasai Kowmei]]
Often paired with [[David (housamo)|]]

Member of the baseball team from a prestigious school known for their sporting prowess. However, he is only a sub member. He aims to become a professional player in the future but his skills are still sub-par and it will be a while before he makes the starting lineup. Drawn to his sincerity and tactless honesty, a Transient shepherd named David took a liking to him and possessed him. Though he himself lacks talent, he is well-liked by people who do have it which gives him opportunity to hone his skills and better himself. However, talented people cause him to feel inferior so he can't help but rebel against their advice.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Kyuma":https://housamo.wiki/Kyuma

title: kagutsuchi_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Kasai Kowmei]]

A Transient who appeared from the other world of Takamagahara. His Summoner belongs to a dojo in Tokyo. He's also part of the karate club at his school and takes martial arts seriously. Because he was unable to control his power in the past, he lost his bond with his parents. He is currently striving to become stronger so that he can control himself. He sees his past self in those who boast inherent powers and thus does not entertain a good opinion of them.

title: avarga_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Kasai Kowmei]]

A Transient hailing from the world of Xanadu, Avarga has found employment in Tokyo as an instructor and wrestling coach at Yoyogi Academy in Shibuya. His skills are widely respected in the city's martial arts circles, and he maintains strong ties to other schools specializing in close-quarters combat. While he was originally human, he now shares a body with the divine bird Khangarid, as evidenced by the feathers that constantly flutter about him. The monstrous strength he possesses is extraordinary even by Xanadu standards; if legends are to be believed, he once wrestled a great dragon to the ground with his bare hands. He is well-liked by his students for his affable, roguish demeanor, but a very different and far more intimidating side comes to the fore when angered... such as by a certain teacher at Daikanyama Academy, whom he views as his mortal rival.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Avarga":https://housamo.wiki/Avarga

title: chernobog_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[kira nerisu]]

He is the incarnation of night, frost, and death that is bound by the barren mountain. He is a Transient come to Tokyo from the world called Kitezh. Ice crystals float around him in response to his Sacred Artifact. It becomes like a tent that brings forth the darkness of the night and a blanket of cold. He can also change the structure of the ice crystals at will, turning them into scythes or armor that he can wears. If is anyone would brave the mountain against all odds to challenge him, even if they were to heroically defeat him, he would afford them the utmost respect.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Chernobog":https://housamo.wiki/Chernobog

title: homura_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character from [[Senran Kagura]]. A second-year Shinobi at the Hebijo Academy.

Homura has [[black hair]], worn in a long [[ponytail]] tied with a [[white ribbon]]. She has [[tan|tanned skin]], and blue-gray eyes. She is usually seen wearing an all [[black serafuku]] with red trim, the Hebijo Academy's uniform. She wears wrist guards similar to [[Asuka (senran kagura)|]]'s. She also wears long [[socks]] over [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. When her clothes are [[torn clothes|ripped off]], she is revealed to be wearing a simple [[black bikini]].

Her favorite food is meat (Japanese food), and favorite hobby is fighting. Descendant of a prestigious ninja family, Homura was originally a good shinobi. And later a former adversary to Asuka during her time as leader of the Hebijo Academy, but ultimately developing a mutual rivalry developed between the two.

Homura is often seen fighting with six [[katana]] at the same time, three in each hand. Her 7th blade Nodachi (Engetsuka) unleashes her ultimate secret ninja art, giving her crimson red hair, bearing a striking resemblance to [[Shana]]. Her guardian animal is the Japanese ratsnake.

Her seiyuu is [[Kitamura Eri]].

h4. External links

* "Kagurapedia: Homura":https://senrankagura.fandom.com/wiki/Homura
* "MyAnimeList: Homura":https://myanimelist.net/character/67533/Homura

title: cthugha_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[jacketbear]]

Transient from Old Ones who is both an ex-ruler and a bodybuilder. He is believed to have come from the isolated star of Fomalhaut to this planet. The specs of the body he was born with are unusually high. However, he is extremely weak on the mental front to the point that it can eclipse his physical strong points. He can't handle complex thinking and is especially bad at numbers. Despite normally speaking with confidence, Cthugha has a surprisingly low self-esteem. It depresses him when his words come back to haunt him and cause him to physically blow up and damage his surroundings. Those who know this about him see him as someone who's dangerous when summoned, so that's why he's alone. His summoning this time has him misunderstanding and becoming an overpowered reincarnated hero from some story somewhere, and now it looks like he's attempting to turn things around in one big home run. Since he doesn't understand bantering and has burned countless followers, it appears the ex-ruler and winner at life in Aoyama is avoiding him. This relationship has not changed since their time at Old Ones, and there is no sign of making a new connection here. Cthugha has one-sided feelings of sympathy for people who appear to talk in circles but not get anywhere.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Cthugha":[https://housamo.wiki/Cthugha]

title: licho_(housamo)
body:
A [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Hinami (ryuusei potechi)]]

A second-year high school student at Umamichi Academy. Though he is only the secretary of the student council, in practice he does nearly everything by himself, as the other members rarely even show up. A Transient from Penglai, he was once a human poet but was transformed into a tiger. Sometime after arriving in Tokyo, his fur changed into the white color it is today. He acts like a delinquent, but at his core, he is serious and responsible. However, he also has an overconfident streak that makes him overestimate his knowledge and ability, as well as a penchant for spouting old-fashioned poetry and proverbs. His past experiences have given him a phobia of failure, which often ends up dashing his otherwise-earnest efforts. He is the type to be easily overwhelmed by those with high social status or imposing demeanors.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Licho":https://housamo.wiki/Licho

title: hephaestus_(housamo)
body:
A [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Gomtang]]

A genius System engineer who hails from the world of Olympus, but is now affiliated with the Crafters and attends university in Kamata. Although born to the bloodline that produces World Representatives, his peers refused to count him among their number and expelled him from Olympus while he was still an infant. He refers to the woman who raised him in their place as his Mama, and venerates her and those who bear her likeness to the point of zealotry. Out of shame at his appearance, he has meticulously created a robotic version of his ideal self, whom he calls Talos. Hephaestus himself feels deep sympathy for those who were abandoned at a young age, and feels compelled to help ease their pain just as they ease his. By contrast, Talos is drawn to those who, much like himself, were created so that they might be loved by others.

h4. External Links 

* "Housamo Wiki:  Hephaestus":https://housamo.wiki/Hephaestus

title: balor_(housamo)
body:
A [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Gomtang]]

World Representative of Tir na Nog, which plans to achieve eternity through Substitution. At one point in the past, his left eye was fumigated by magical smoke which led to it gaining the power to confer death to those he looks at. This power scatters about death on the battlefield without regards to friend or foe, but by borrowing the power of another this eye can become sealed. He has been through many wars and has gained fame as a general and the proudest king of the giants. However due to a defeat from a certain point in time, all of his dignity was stripped away and his pride was broken, and in the end he became someone who waited for his death penalty to be carried out within prison. He wishes to die on the battlefield as opposed to an execution ground, so he accepted some arrangements to be used by other World Representatives. After being imprisoned in the military academy prison in Nerima, he now works as a combat instructor training death row inmates as soldiers. Balor thinks about the comrades who killed and died on the same battlefields as he has. The lingering smoke there still smoulders in his eyes even now.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Balor":[https://housamo.wiki/Balor]

title: get_down_(meme)
body:
Japanese [[meme]] that originates from the act of causing glitches in [[GoldenEye 007]] for the Nintendo 64 by tilting the cartridge, making actors or objects spin wildly.

The song ""promise":[https://youtube.com/watch?v=ifs4zmWD3ms]" by Hirose Koumi was later added to complete the meme. The spastic action of the character (or object) is a match for the song's chorus. The meme also known as "geddan" due to misheard lyrics.

h4. External links
* "Original song":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ifs4zmWD3ms
* "Video of the glitches in GoldenEye":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SP5c_MEs9mo
* "The dancing routine that was invented in 2ch after":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wrTqNYf58i4

h4. Lyrics

Get down
Yureru mawaru fureru setsunai kimochi
--([i]A shaking, spinning, touching, painful feeling[/i])

Futari de issho ni nemuru winter land
--([i]Sleeping together in a winter land[/i])

Anata dake mitsumete watashi dake mitsumete
--([i]You looking only at me, me looking only at you[/i])

Asu wo chikau.
--([i]We make a promise for tomorrow.[/i])

-
Gyutto dakare moeru koigokoro
--([i]You hold me tight and I feel a burning love[/i])

Hageshiku maichiru yuki ni tsutsumarete
--([i]Wrapped in the heavily falling snow[/i])

Eien ni ai shiteru kyou yori ai shiteru
--([i]I’ll love you forever, I’ll love you even more than today[/i])

Zutto eternal love.
--([i]Forever, eternal love.[/i])

[b]-Lyric source - kiwi-musume.com/lyrics/hirosekoumi[/b]

title: jacob_(housamo)
body:
A [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Gomtang]]

A half American half Japanese man who belongs to a boxing club. He is a third year student in Shibuya Ward's international school Daikanyama Academy, but he is currently taking a leave of absence from there. His specialty is a ferocious left and right barrage while moving his upper body in a figure eight. His eyesight is impaired, and he once lived through very rough circumstances. However, it is said that by chance he learned of love after fighting with a certain Transient and changed his way of life. Traces of that time sometimes comes out as slang he speaks when his spirit gets excited. While he can't see, he understands the risks and is an infighter who jumps in close to his enemies. Jacob believes that sometimes speaking with your bodies with zero distance between them is how true love is gotten across. He is quick to agree with and like people who like wandering journeys while being aware of the dangers.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Jacob":https://housamo.wiki/Jacob

title: algernon_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[Dai-xt]]

A cyborg Transient from the world of Utopia, he was originally human, but has been modified and upgraded from the brain out. The name Algernon refers to both the Helmet he wears, which is actually his Sacred Artifact, and the name of his partner and manager; the cyborg himself is deeply mistrustful of others and has confided his real name to no one other than his partner. He despises dirt and disorder, and takes an active role in keeping his school clean and tidy. Outside of school, he moonlights as a very discriminating assassin for hire, only accepting jobs that contribute to keeping Tokyo's streets clean of garbage in an entirely different way.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Algernon":[https://housamo.wiki/Algernon]

title: takemaru_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[rybiok]]

Hailing from the Land of Wa, where he led the Eastern ogres, Takemaru enjoys DIY projects. He surrendered his blade, his only form of protection, in order to protect his friends, and has instead made sure his neck will be invulnerable from now on. Since coming to Tokyo, he has joined the group that bonded his neck, the Kamata Crafters, and is attending college to learn about architecture. He recognizes his own dislike of angels and humans, races who have deceived him in the past, and yet he possesses a strong sense of duty and is easily charmed. He dreams of one day having a life companion to be lovey-dovey with, so he's devoted himself to creating a home fit for that future.

h4. External Links

* "Housamo Wiki: Takemaru":[https://housamo.wiki/Takemaru]

title: akiha_gongen_(housamo)
body:
[[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]] character.
Designed by [[dyzd1]]

A karasu tengu Transient from the world of Wa no Kuni. He's a mild gangster who really loves the area he was summoned to and has tanned skin. He attends Akihabara Academy where many creative types go to school, where he takes traditional craft courses in things like swordsmithing and clothes making. There are many other students who attend this school that love the other courses like manga, anime, game distribution, and illustration. He may not understand it much, but Akiha thinks highly of his friends who are so passionate about their favorite things. He is very assertive in trying out somewhat risque cosplay, and his nearby friends often get involved with it. Some of those around him call him the "black crow who's nice to otaku," but of course he doesn't get this. Outside of school, he works hard every morning in training drills as part of his local youth firefighter team and super buff clique. Akiha is enthusiastic about protecting the city of Tokyo with his own hands from the disasters arising from increasing social anxiety nowadays. Should someone close to him ask him for help, Akiha would use his power and jump into the sea of flames to do so. But it's also because of this power that some of the passionate creators around him fear him and distance themselves from him.

h4. External links

* "Housamo Wiki: Akiha Gongen":https://housamo.wiki/Akiha_Gongen

* [[Kon-El]] - A clone of Clark Kent, uses the alias during his days in the Teen Titans and Young Justice
* [[Jonathan Kent]] - The Superboy of the DC Rebirth continuity. Clark Kent and Lois Lane's son.

title: ose_(housamo)
body:
"A Transient originally from the world of Gehenna, Ose is now active in Tokyo as a spy for the shadowy Agents, codenamed 057. He is an undisputed master of disguise, and can appear as a child or an adult at will depending on his mood. Even the most challenging of assignments pose little problem for him thanks to his exceptional natural talents, but this only leaves him bored and disinterested. He frequently attempts to seduce enemies well-disposed toward him, and sometimes takes unnecessary risks while on the job, likely in an attempt to bring more excitement to his work life."

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Ose":https://housamo.wiki/Ose

title: oz_(housamo)
body:
"This Transient comprises two Lion Therians in one body: the hesitant and cowardly Oz, and his polar opposite, the brash and intimidating Zo. Only the most robust of vessels could accommodate two such fully developed personalities, and so, on a conceptual level, their shared body is impervious to harm from any weapon. In their home world, the pair lived lives of solitary kingship, with one ruling a forest and the other a deep gorge, but they lamented their fates, and so the light of the Transient brought them to Tokyo. The cowardly Oz dreams of one day becoming an astronaut, and indeed their Role dictates that one day they will leave the earth behind to shine amongst the stars, but the two disagree to this day about what exactly will lead them there."

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Oz":https://housamo.wiki/Oz

He is often paired with [[Touhou]]'s [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[M.U.G.E.N]]  and other fan works since both of them were formerly humans.

title: yagami_iori
body:
Main character in [[SNK]]'s [i][[The King Of Fighters]][/i] series. Introduced in [[The King of Fighters '95]], Iori and [[Kusanagi Kyou]] have been bitter rivals since. 

Iori is tied to [[Orochi (kof)|]] by blood, which caused his Blood Riot form, better known as Wild Iori or [[Orochi Iori]]. 

It has never been said if Iori was truly an antagonist. At times he plays a supporting role and at other times he just causes trouble. 

He is often paired with [[Type-Moon]]'s [[Tohno Akiha]] in [[M.U.G.E.N]] fan works. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Iori Yagami":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iori_Yagami
